column4: China's Weibo social media site suspends portals after reprimand
column5: BEIJING China's Sina Weibo  was ordered to move several portals offline for a week after spreading obscene and wrongly oriented content  the internet watchdog said.

column4: Wynn resigns as RNC finance chair after sexual misconduct allegations
column5: WASHINGTON Las Vegas casino mogul Steve Wynn resigned as finance chairman of the Republican Party's fundraising arm on Saturday  a day after a newspaper reported that he routinely subjected women who worked for him to unwanted sexual advances. | Video

column4: BRIEF-Egypt's Arabian Food Industries Posts Q4 Consol Profit
column5: * Q4 CONSOL NET PROFIT EGP 30.6 MILLION VERSUS LOSS OF EGP 29 MILLION YEAR AGO

column4: India likely to put pedal to metal on asset sales
column5: MUMBAI/NEW DELHI  Jan 28 India's government may look to raise as much as a record 1 trillion rupees ($15.7 billion) from the sale of state assets in the next fiscal year to help meet tough fiscal deficit limits while giving it room to boost spending and woo voters before general elections that must be called by early 2019.

column4: ATM makers warn of 'jackpotting' hacks on U.S. machines
column5: Diebold Nixdorf Inc and NCR Corp  two of the world's largest ATM makers  have warned that cyber criminals are targeting U.S. cash machines with tools that force them to spit out cash in hacking schemes known as "jackpotting." | Video

column4: UPDATE 1-ATM makers warn of 'jackpotting' hacks on U.S. machines
column5: Jan 27 Diebold Nixdorf Inc and NCR Corp  two of the world's largest ATM makers  have warned that cyber criminals are targeting U.S. cash machines with tools that force them to spit out cash in hacking schemes known as "jackpotting."

column4: Opel to export cars to Tunisia  Morocco: CEO in FAZ
column5: FRANKFURT PSA Group's Opel plans to start exporting cars to Tunisia and Morocco from its European plants  its chief executive told German daily Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (FAZ) in an interview.

column4: Opel to export cars to Tunisia  Morocco - CEO in FAZ
column5: FRANKFURT  Jan 28 PSA Group's Opel plans to start exporting cars to Tunisia and Morocco from its European plants  its chief executive told German daily Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (FAZ) in an interview.
